text.sentence: Technology | U.S. Software twenty one August two thousand fifteen
Another impressive quarter: Salesforce reported very healthy FY Qtwo results, which should be well received by investors.
percent ahead of consensus on a reported basis at dollar one.sixty

one billion, though we note that adjusted for FX as well as a small benefit from invoicing changes, the number would likely have come in over dollar one.seven billion at around twenty seven percent y/y growth.
The company also beat on revenue and profitability and raised guidance.
We think the strength Salesforce is seeing is broad based across product lines and geographies, and we reiterate our OW rating.
We are raising our target price to dollar eighty from dollar seventy nine.
Broad based top line strength: Transaction volume has seen consistent growth and backlog is up twenty four percent y/y compared to twenty five percent last quarter.

Geographically, all areas performed well with the Americas and Europe coming in at twenty eight percent and twenty nine percent y/y growth in constant currency, respectively, and APAC at +twenty five percent .
The company continues to see better traction with its industry offerings and with larger deals.

Looking at product level data, the stand out was once again the Service Cloud with forty percent growth y/y, but the Marketing Cloud and Platform were also healthy at +twenty nine percent y/y and +thirty six percent y/y, respectively.
Leverage More Apparent: We think profitability improvements are more of a part of the Salesforce story now.
The company showed a strong four hundredbp improvement in OPEX as a percentage of revenue.
Gross margins are slightly lower due to datacenter investments and an ongoing infrastructure build out, although we see this as temporary.
Valuation: We are increasing our target price accordingly with our increased FYsixteen revenue estimate increase.
Our new top line estimate is dollar six.six hundred twenty eight billion, one.three
percent higher than our previous estimate of dollar six.five hundred forty one billion.
Our target price is based on an unchanged target multiple of ~sevenx.

PLEASE SEE ANALYST CERTIFICATION AND IMPORTANT DISCLOSURES BEGINNING ON PAGE twelve.

U.S. Software Industry View: POSITIVE Stock Rating: OVERWEIGHT two thousand fifteenA five thousand three hundred seventy four eight hundred sixty seven five hundred seventy four three hundred fifty seven three hundred forty two .fifty

two thousand sixteenE six thousand six hundred twenty eight one thousand two hundred fifty eight eight hundred seventeen five hundred fifty five four hundred eighty seven .seventy two six hundred seventy four.six .

two thousand eighteenE nine thousand four hundred one one thousand seven hundred seventy two one thousand three hundred thirty three eight hundred twenty five eight hundred six one.fourteen
We like the large scale of the Sales Force Automation business and expect strong growth there to continue.
We also like the move into other application markets such as with Customer Service and Marketing clouds.
The new areas Salesforce has expanded into such as Marketing and Salesforceone for Mobile, as well as greater enterprise and industry focus, could drive more growth than we currently expect.
Our upside case is based on a CYfifteen EV/Sales of eightx and a ten percent increase to revenue.
The new growth initiatives around enterprise strategy and move to new market areas may not pay off, which will lead to a growth slowdown but still relatively high costs.
Our downside case is based on a CYfifteen EV/Sales of four.sevenx and a ten percent revenue cut.

Billings was the main headline, at two.one percent ahead of Street estimates.
eightbn, driven by better top line results of dollar one.six
hundred ninety nine billion, though deferred revenue of dollar three.three billion was just shy of consensus of dollar three.five billion.
Operating cash flow came in at dollar three hundred fourm vs. consensus of dollar two hundred fiftym.

one thousand five hundred eighty one thousand four hundred ninety one hundred ten one thousand five hundred ninety nine one thousand two hundred fifty seventy eight.two
Guidance has been provided for Qthree and updated for the full two thousand sixteen fiscal year.
Top line guidance for the quarter came in at dollar one.sixty

hundred seventy five billion, and full year revenue guidance was dollar six.six ­ six.six hundred twenty five billion versus the previous range of dollar six.five hundred twenty ­ six.five hundred fifty billion, which was ahead of street expectations of dollar six.five hundred forty six billion.
two was in line with full year consensus expectations of dollar .seventy at the midpoint.
We had previously believed that guidance was conservative, and the consistent beat and raise story here has so far confirmed this view.
Guidance Qthree sixteen Revenue EPS, non GAAP one thousand six hundred ninety ­ one thousand seven hundred .eighteen
percent Guidance FY sixteen six thousand six hundred ­ six thousand six hundred twenty five .seventy
two Consensus FY sixteen six thousand five hundred forty six .seventy
Deferred revenue came in at dollar three.three billion, which is up twenty nine percent y/y on an unadjusted basis and slightly behind consensus estimates of dollar three.five billion.
We note that in constant currency, deferred revenue grew ~thirty three percent y/y and revenue grew ~twenty eight percent y/y.

We have highlighted below that on an annual basis deferred revenue saw a headwind from FX changes of approximately dollar seventy five million, whereas total revenue saw a smaller but significant impact.
We continue to believe investors will feel comfortable with the billings result, as FX impacts lessen and due to broad based strength .
seventy four percent of all subscription and support based invoiced are being billed with annual terms, up from ~seventy one percent a year ago.
The benefit from shifting customers to annual terms upon renewal and the annual invoicing policy was ~one percent to deferred revenue .
In Figure four, we summarize the FX impact to billings this quarter as well as the invoicing change effect.
Total revenue FX tailwind Deferred revenue FX headwind Annual invoicing tailwind
On an adjusted basis, we think billings probably came in closer to twenty seven percent y/y when adjusted for the FX effects and the invoicing effect described in the figure above.
Backlog remains solid with Qtwo coming in at dollar six.twobn as we show in Figure five.

We have seen a general deceleration in growth here that we have tracked each quarter however, we do note that the trend line seems to be flattening, implying that growth might actually be sustained for longer than expected ­ which would obviously be an incremental positive.
Growth ticked down just slightly from twenty five percent y/y last quarter.
Total deferred revenue plus backlog was dollar nine.two hundred thirty five billion and is up twenty six percent y/y.
We would also note that transaction volume reached two hundred thirty four billion in the quarter, up approximately seventy nine percent y/y .
The story here is unchanged, and we view these figures as very strong.
This is only the second quarter that we have been able to track year over year growth by product segment, but the result has been positive.
Salesforce began breaking these numbers in Qone of FYfifteen, but this is only the first sequential comparison of y/y growth rates
We saw broad based strength with notable increases in growth in every product group.
We show the change in y/y growth rates from last quarter in the figure below.
One of the core drivers of the Salesforce thesis is growth from multiple product areas a broadening offering that can help the company grow at scale.
Seeing acceleration in every product group, even the mature Sales Cloud, is certainly encouraging.
Service Cloud and the Salesforceone Platform as well as Marketing Cloud are buoying overall growth, with Service Cloud accelerating this quarter to forty percent y/y growth.
It will be interesting in our view to see the growth of Wave, the Analytics Cloud, when it becomes a meaningful enough contributor to revenue to be broken out separately.

Constant currency growth was more balanced this quarter, with the Americas and EMEA up twenty eight percent and twenty nine percent, respectively in constant currency, while APAC grew just slightly slower at twenty five percent in constant currency.
While weakness in APAC has been a common theme for investors recently, we note that APAC only accounts for roughly nine percent of total revenue currently for Salesforce.
Scale is better across the board, though we think the bigger benefit is coming in for S and M expense and G and A, and a little less so for R and D expense.

Gross margin has not really contributed to this trend, in fact, the company is seeing some pressure here due to ongoing investments in data center build outs among other factors; however, we do note that sales and marketing has declined from forty four.five

percent of revenue in the year ago quarter to forty three percent of sales this quarter, and G and A has declined from ten.nine percent of sales last year to nine.five percent of revenue this quarter.
The opportunity for further leverage is clear in our view and it should continue.
Management has guided to one hundred fifty bps of operating margin expansion for the full year, which is the high end of the previous range of one hundred twenty five one hundred fifty bps.
We show the operating margin trend over time in Figure eight below.
We note that operating margin expansion of one hundred seventy bps in this quarter is a continuation of positive trends we highlighted last quarter, and impressive given ongoing FX issues.

Operating cash flow for the quarter came in at dollar three hundred four million, which was up twenty four percent y/y, and the company maintained full year guidance for operating cash flow growth in the range of two thousand four hundred twenty five percent, versus thirty four percent y/y in FYfifteen.
six billion in operating cash flow for fiscal two thousand sixteen.

We continue to view Salesforce dot com versus peers in terms of valuation on an EV/Sales basis, since the company remains highly concentrated on growing the top line, and getting a point of reference on the comparatively high FCF multiples in the SaaS space remains difficult.
Our FYsixteen revenue estimates are increasing slightly, concurrent with management's guidance raise ­ we still think there could be some upside bias.

We have increased our FYtwo thousand sixteen revenue estimates from dollar six.five hundred forty one billion to dollar six.six hundred twenty eight billion and increased our EPS estimates from dollar .seventy
Our price target is dollar eighty, based on a calendarized two thousand sixteen EV/Sales multiple of ~sevenx.
We continue to view Salesforce dot com as one of the SaaS names in our space that is most attractive for long term investors, and the stock's current valuation of ~six.fivex

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .

Valuation Methodology: Our dollar eighty price target is based on a calendar two thousand sixteen EV/Sales multiple of sevenx and a revenue estimate of dollar seven.ninebn.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: Saleforce competes in the highly competitive enterprise software market, and larger entrants such as Microsoft, SAP, and Oracle could undermine pricing support over time, making it difficult for Salesforce to achieve its financial objectives.
As a high growth company carrying a relatively high valuation, shares are susceptible to significant multiple pressure during market selloffs.
